definition: a shout/fig. opinion or demand, esp. expressed by a group
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale

sentences.english: Also noisemakers are thought to be used at parties as a way of scaring away the evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 而且，在生日會上發出的歡呼聲能夠嚇跑邪惡的幽靈。

sentences.english: They too have been deaf to the voice of justice and of consanguinity.
sentences.chinese: 可他們對這種正義和同宗的呼聲也同樣充耳不聞。

sentences.english: There are new calls for South Carolina's embattled Governor to quit.
sentences.chinese: 又有新的呼聲要求南卡羅萊那州長辭職。

sentences.english: The cheer of the fan echo round the grind as the team appear.
sentences.chinese: 球隊剛一上場，球迷的歡呼聲立即響遍全場。

sentences.english: They shouted louder and louder and finally hit each other on the head with their stone hatchets.
sentences.chinese: 他們喊出的呼聲強烈，最後擊中頭部與石斧頭對方。

sentences.english: Migratory songs wing from my heart and seek their nests in your voice od love.
sentences.chinese: 飄泊的歌兒從我心中飛去在你愛的呼聲裏尋找窠巢。

sentences.english: Those in the orphanages needs cheerfulness.
sentences.chinese: 那些孤兒院需要歡呼聲。

sentences.english: The grito was cancelled in Ciudad Juarez for the first time in its history.
sentences.chinese: 華瑞茲市有史以來第一次取消了多洛雷斯呼聲。

sentences.english: Through his newspaper the liberator he became the voice of abolition .
sentences.chinese: 通過他的報紙，解放者，繼任呼聲裁撤。

sentences.english: I lowered my head silence, until around cheering happened frequently.
sentences.chinese: 我低着頭沉默，直到周圍歡呼聲迭起。

sentences.english: Chen Zhonghe, mostly favored, was elected out unexpectedly and lost the election for another term.
sentences.chinese: 呼聲最高的陳忠和意外落選，失去了連任的機會。

sentences.english: It’s not surprising that arguments against the Fed are finally resonating.
sentences.chinese: 反對美聯儲的呼聲最終獲得了共鳴並不令人感到意外。

sentences.english: He shut his ears to all appeals for help.
sentences.chinese: 他對於一切求助的呼聲都不聞不問。

sentences.english: Wave upon wave of applause washed over us.
sentences.chinese: 歡呼聲一浪高過一浪地向我們湧來。

sentences.english: I see the nature of the current crises in the juxtaposition of the individual to society.
sentences.chinese: 我理解當今反對把個人和社會並排一起的呼聲的本質。

sentences.english: At this point, the square to participate in a get-together of people issued flood of cheers.
sentences.chinese: 此時，廣場上參加聯歡的民衆發出潮水般的歡呼聲。

definition: to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
odds of success/stratagem that ensures success/to be sure of success
the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
